Name.label: Disorder of phospholipids, sphingolipids and fatty acids biosynthesis with skeletal muscle predominant involvement

TextSection.Contents: A rare, genetic, skeletal muscle disease characterized by an early-onset hypotonia, muscle weakness, global developmental delay with intellectual disability, and cardiomyopathy. Congenital structural heart defects and ichthyosiform cutaneous lesions have also been associated. Muscle biopsy shows characteristic enlarged mitochondria located at the periphery of muscle fibers.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Congenital muscular dystrophy due to phosphatidylcholine biosynthesis defect
Congenital muscular dystrophy with mitochondrial structural abnormalities
